Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the cost of the Covid relief plan by stating that it will cost every American $5,750, without considering variations in individual costs.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential impact of the relief plan by not providing enough information about the benefits it provides to certain individuals.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that every American will be directly impacted by the cost of the relief plan.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the cost of the relief plan will be evenly distributed among all Americans, which is not how the system works.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for how the cost of the relief plan will be paid back, such as raising taxes on the rich or future spending adjustments.
